questions.question: Between interstitial and substitutional diffusion, which is faster and why?

answers.a: Interstitial diffusion is faster because smaller atoms can easily move between lattice sites, whereas substitutional diffusion involves the exchange of larger atoms, which encounter more resistance.
answers.b: Substitutional diffusion is faster because atoms directly replace existing atoms within the lattice, whereas interstitial diffusion requires atoms to navigate through the lattice structure.
answers.c: Substitutional diffusion is faster because it involves the movement of atoms into spaces between existing atoms, allowing for quicker migration compared to the exchange process in interstitial diffusion.
answers.d: Interstitial diffusion is faster because it occurs at higher temperatures, promoting more rapid atomic movement compared to the slower process of substitutional diffusion.
